communications.subject: Thank you for contacting the Department of Public Safety Re: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: UMN Police Report
communications.communication:
If this is an emergency or an urgent concern, please call 9-1-1.  If you witness or have a situation that needs immediate attention, please call 9-1-1. 

This account is not actively monitored.  Emails to the University of Minnesota Department of Public Safety are normally responded to within 2-3 business days.  If you require assistance sooner, please contact us at 612 624-COPS (2677). 

If you are emailing to report a crime, please either call us at 612 624-2677 or visit our department at 505 Washington Ave SE to file a police report.  Police reports are not accepted at this email address. 

For media inquiries, please contact University Relations at unews@umn.edu. (mailto:unews@umn.edu) 

Thank you.

title: Erik van Sabben (31 January 1972 - 16 January 2009)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Erik van Sabben (31 January 1972 - 16 January 2009)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or pertaining to the late Dutch businessman Erik van Sabben (31 January 1972 - 16 January 2009) including (but not limited to) any and all records of border crossing, travel, or secondary screening.

Van Sabben was the business development manager of Dubai's TTS International. A recent news report by Volkskrant (https://volkskrant.nl/nieuws-achtergrond/aivd-speelde-cruciale-rol-bij-sabotage-kernprogramma-iran~ba24df9f/) named him as a Dutch intelligence asset.

Van Sabben's death was widely reported (https://www.thenationalnews.com/uae/engineer-who-helped-build-the-maqta-bridge-1.553285). As such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

I have located this data at the following link: https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

However, the data at this link does not contain the full text of the initiative/referendum. In addition, it contains only information on elections dating back to 1986, while I request data for elections dating back to 1972.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: RE: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Board of Elections)
communications.communication:
March 7, 2024

Dear Jimin Han,

On March 6, 2024, you submitted a request for public records from the State of RI Board of Elections, pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act (“APRA”).

You requested data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972, which was to include the following information:

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)
For Items #1, #2 and #3; the State of Rhode Island Board of Elections has no records responsive to your request. Please direct your request for those items to the Rhode Island Department of State Elections’ Division: https://www.sos.ri.gov/

For Items #4 and #5; the elections results may be obtained for each year from the State of Rhode Island Board of Elections website:  https://elections.ri.gov/elections/previous-election-results

For Item #6; the threshold for any local ballot initiative/referenda to pass is always 50%.

If you believe you have been denied access to public records from the Rhode Island Board of Elections, you have a right to file a review petition with Miguel J. Nunez, the Executive Director of the Rhode Island Board of Elections, 2000 Plainfield Pike, Cranston, RI 02921.

If you are still not satisfied, you may file an appeal with the Attorney General or initiate proceedings in Superior Court.

Regards,

[cid:image001.png@01DA705E.86AA85D0]Richard E. Thornton, Director of Campaign Finance/APRA Coordinator
RI Board of Elections | Website<http://www.elections.ri.gov/> | Twitter: @RI_BOE<https://twitter.com/RI_BOE>
Email: richard.thornton@elections.ri.gov<mailto:richard.thornton@elections.ri.gov>
2000 Plainfield Pike, Cranston, RI 02921 | 401-222-1907

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (secretary of state)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

This website from California provides a good example of the type of data I am requesting:
https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

communications.subject: RE: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Secretary of State, Elections and Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear Jimin,

You may access information regarding past local ballot initiatives/referenda here: Minnesota Secretary Of State - Election Results<https://www.sos.state.mn.us/elections-voting/election-results/>. Additional information may be located at the Minnesota Legislative Reference Library, which is linked in that page.

Please note that not all local ballot initiatives or referenda are reported to the Office of the Secretary of State and so we do not have data on all of those matters.

Respectfully,

Justin R. Erickson
Deputy General Counsel
Pronouns: he, him, his
Office of Minnesota Secretary of State, Steve Simon
We've moved!

St. Paul, MN 55155

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

communications.communication:
Jimin,

    We have none of that information.  Local elections are strictly a county affair.  The voter database records the last 10 elections a voter voted in, but that would not be responsive to your request.

   If you want to contact each county:  https://sos.ks.gov/elections/county_election_officers.aspx


Clay

Clay Barker
General Counsel, KS Secretary of State

communications.subject: RE: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Department of Elections)
communications.communication:
Dear Johnathan Rudenberg –

The Department has received your FOIA request, below.  Please be advised the Department does not possess any records responsive to your request.  Delaware does not include ballot initiatives/referenda on ballots.

The Department does not maintain municipal election records.  For these records you may wish to contact Delaware’s municipalities.  Links to Delaware’s municipalities’ websites are available on the Department’s Municipal Elections webpage, https://elections.delaware.gov/municipality/index.shtml.

Thank you very much.

Best,


Cathleen Hartsky-Carter

Community Relations Officer/FOIA Coordinator

State of Delaware Department of Elections

905 S Governors Ave, Suite 170

Dover, DE 19904

302-739-4277

https://elections.delaware.gov<https://elections.delaware.gov/>

https://ivote.de.gov<https://ivote.de.gov/>

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (secretary of state)
communications.communication:
In Wisconsin, voter registration and elections are overseen by the Elections Commission, not the Secretary of State Office.  You can contact Elections for further information at 608-266-8005 or via https://elections.wi.gov/

The legislature in Wisconsin has control over setting elections in Wisconsin.  I would advise you to reach out to your legislator if you have any concerns.  If you are unsure who may represent you, you can find your legislator through maps.legis.wisconsin.gov<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__maps.legis.wisconsin.gov_&d=DwMFAg&c=HhgxO5mnlCoNHjwVH-wED6Mwc4Z-psO9z_38k9ow5oI&r=Ir5BBZ1NfD0SXloKv7gtezQ105JY2_LIwTRmx61iGs4&m=WYvXcrE7Fbeul6YSl_nb4u9rJAnZ2vme7VO2Q21rXf0&s=aRDj_iVorNyKKUnzsfudlovLPtKlgdbLfwqIiYjok4Q&e=>.  Use the search box in the upper right corner to enter your address.
Best,

Jessa
